name: Persicaria humboldtiana
distribution: Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.490.1.5 The specific epithet is a tribute to the German explorer, geographer and naturalist Friedrich Wilhelm Heinrich Alexander von Humboldt (1769–1859), who was originally honoured by the name Hansa Humboldt, the original name of Corupá, the Brazilian municipality where the new species, according to the best of evidence, is restricted to.
